text: Maurice Sanford Fox (October 11, 1924 â€“ January 26, 2020) was an American geneticist and molecular biologist. He was professor Emeritus of Biology at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), where he was department chair between 1985 and 1989. He was important for the creation of the Council for a Livable World. Fox died on January 26, 2020 at the age of 95.Maurice Fox, professor emeritus of biology, dies at 95 ==References== Category:2020 deaths Category:1924 births Category:American geneticists Category:American biologists Category:Educators from New York City Category:Scientists from New York City
title: Maurice Sanford Fox
